comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I do not know where this is yet, but I have an idea that the bridge (which does not look like convict masonry to me) might be a railway bridge, due to the shallow gradient of the approaches and its apparent strange location half way down a hill away from the town.   The church is fairly distinctive, as are all the pre-federation large houses.   Blue Mountains?

comment.author: 12852675@N08
comment._content: It's interesting that the clouds were obviously put on the negative with someone's finger.  They look very wrong, yet add to the depth of the photograph.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: Its not the Lennox Bridge at Lapstone.  Nothing like it at all.  Its quite puzzling.  I wonder if it could be down the back of Marrickville somewhere.

comment.author: 87208252@N03
comment._content: nice pic how did you do it

comment.author: 79583367@N02
comment._content: I'm surprised no-one has identified the site.  The church is really substantial and should be easily identified by the "experts".
